comments.body:
(This doesn't prevent this from being merged but so you know for future releases.)

This file shouldn't needed as, according to this line, there should be a copy of this licence included with every distribution of the package. It should be automatically included in the release tarballs on PyPI if you edit your `setup.cfg` to include:

```
[metadata]
license_files = LICENSE
```

See [here (and the sample project)](https://packaging.python.org/guides/distributing-packages-using-setuptools/#license-txt) for more details.

Doing this would remove the need to include this file with the recipe and also ensures that the text is always up to date.
Thanks! The tarballs do indeed include the license file. I just assumed it was a requirement since other pull requests included a LICENSE file as well.
